name: English Audio Grammar Complete Handbook
description: Learn English grammar with the following audios. The lessons cover verb forms, tenses,  negative and positive sentences, asking and answering questions as well as conditional sentences,  question tags and other commonly used English grammar constructs.  Learning English grammar How to use ? Read the following grammar lessons, listen to the audios and make notes.  In your day to day conversation, try to find out situations where you use the grammar concept that you just read.  Regular study and reflection will help you understand all these rules and methods and build the ability to use them in conversation when required.   Audio lessons in grammar :   Be Verbs - Simple Present Likes Basic Verbs Verb Agreement (is/are) english grammar audio books Adjectives Days of the Week Nationalities Basic Sentence Patterns Subject Pronouns Object Pronouns english grammar audio best book Be - Simple Present Simple Present Imperatives Articles english grammar in use audio book Adverbs of Frequency Can - Abilities Past Tense - Be (Was, Were) Transitive Verbs Stative Verbs english audio grammar practice There is / There are    Present Simple Third Person Singular fundamentals of english grammar audio Present Continuous english grammar exercises Future Tense Going To - Future Tense Simple Past Tense Past Tense - Irregular Verbs Adverbs + Adjectives Comparatives Superlatives    Do for Emphasis Causative Verbs english grammar tenses Used to - Past Tense Would - Past Tense Should - Suggestions Would like to / Want to Present Perfect (Experiences) Have to / Must - Obligation Zero Conditional First Conditional    Coordinating Conjunctions Sub Conjunctions - Time Sub Conjunctions - Reasons Sub Conjunctions - Conditions Second Conditional Adjective Clause Noun Clause english grammar articles english grammar audio lessons That Clause / Projected Speech Present Perfect - Time Past Conditional    Learning by listening helps to improve our listening skills and makes our ears accustomed to the sounds of English.
